caseTitle: Chief Executive Officer NPGCL, GENCO-III, TPS, Muzaffargarh v. Khalid Umar Tariq Imran, etc
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Syed Hasan Azhar Rizvi
tagline:
When a special law governing a proceeding itself provides for a period limitation, the benefit of Section 5 (condonation of delay) cannot be availed unless it has been made applicable by that law in accordance with Section 29(2) of the Limitation Act, 1908.
The doctrine of election—The choice to initiate one out of the available concurrent or co-existent remedies from a competent forum vests with the aggrieved person. However, once the election is made, that party generally cannot be permitted to seek out additional concurrent or co-existent remedies.
